attributes.action: CANCEL AND REVOKE the Data (Use and Access) Bill [HL]
attributes.additional_details:
1. Threat to Privacy - The bill may grant excessive powers to government agencies, allowing unprecedented access to personal data without sufficient oversight.
2. Erosion of Digital Rights - Increased data collection and surveillance could infringe upon the rights to privacy
3. Lack of Transparency and Accountability-concerns about how the collected data will be used, stored, and shared, with insufficient safeguards against misuse.
4. Potential for Abuse 
5. Impact on Businesses and Innovation
attributes.background:
Our Demands
We call on Parliament to:
• Reject the bill to ensure it aligns with fundamental privacy rights and democratic values.
• Hold a mass public consultation to allow citizens, privacy experts, and civil society organizations to express their concerns.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/718528
